Name: Dragon Dice: Battle Chest Expansion
Description:
As the generals of Esfah scramble for an edge in their battles, mystic items, each tied to one of the five elements of Esfah, emerge from treasure troves scattered throughout the land. Mighty weapons and shields, fleet footwear, and magical charms find the hands of those willing to wield them. Now you can harness the power of items and artifacts to assist your armies in their efforts to vanquish your foes.

Each Battle Chest contains a random assortment of 6 single-colored 4-sided items of 5 types and 5 colors in 3 different sizes. It also contains 2 single-colored 10-sided artifacts of 5 types and 5 colors.

Name: Dragon Dice: Battlefields Expansion
Description:
With Battlefields, the Dragon Dice general now has more options for shaping his battlefield.  This expansion includes new basic terrains: the Feylands(Fire and Water) and the Wastelands (Fire and Air); and  new special frontier terrains: the Castle, Dragon Lair, Grove and Vortex; to add a new layer of strategy to your battlefield choices at the start of a game.  You can also alter the battlefield during play with the use of minor terrains, lesser objectives that may give your army a needed boost if you're willing to take a risk.

Box contains 7 terrain dice: 1 Feyland terain in random mix of 8 types, 1 Wasteland terrain in random mix of 8 types, 2 special terrains in random mix of Coastland,Flatland,Highland and Swamplands in 4 types and 3 minor terrains in random mix of all 6 terrain colors and 4 types.

Use of this expansion requires the Dragon Dice Starter Set and Dragon Dice Standard Rules.

Name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Deadlands Expansion
Description: The Deadlands minor terrains are black and ivory. By giving up a maneuver attempt, you can add these to any terrain (ivory matches all colors). That adds black to the terrain color for your army only! 4 dice in this set, 1 of each type.

Name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Dragon Sets Expansion
Description:
This is for all 6 color combinations of Hybrid and Ivory Hybrid dragons that match the options picked

Hybrid Dragons:
These dragons are hybrids of the elemental dragons. Composed of two elements, they have both elements in their very makeup. They generate breath against 5 health of the defending army and both elements of army breath effects against the army. However, the dragons are affected by both elements as well. A Dragon Summoning spell of either element will summon them to a terrain. Eldarim Champions that match either element can affect them normally. Dragon Staffs and Dragonkin Champions of either element also affect them normally. Dragonkin of either matching element cannot be rolled when attacked by an Hybrid dragon. Hybrid Dragons fight all dragons (except pure ivory dragons and ivory hybrids with a matching elemental) that do not match their elements exactly. Elemental and White dragons fight all Hybrid Dragons.

Ivory Hybrid Dragons:
These dragons are hybrids of the elemental dragons and an ivory dragon. Composed of one element and ivory, they have that element in their very makeup, plus all the attributes of the ivory dragons. They generate breath against 5 health of the defending army  and the elemental army breath effect (if any) against the army. A Dragon Summoning spell of any element (reflecting their ivory nature) will summon them to a terrain. Eldarim Champions of a single element that matches the dragon’s elemental can affect them normally. White Eldarim Champions affect them normally. Dragon Staffs and Dragonkin Champions of the same element as the dragon also affect them normally. Just like pure ivory dragons, dragonkin cannot be rolled when attacked by an Ivory Hybrid dragon. Like the pure ivory dragons, once summoned to a terrain, no ivory Dragon Summoning spell can move them. However, a Dragon Summoning spell of their element can move them. Ivory hybrid dragons, like pure ivory dragons, always attack the army at the terrain. However, they are attacked by all hybrid dragons that do not have a matching element. Elemental dragons not matching the ivory hybrid dragon’s element and white dragons attack all ivory hybrid dragons.

Name: Lone General
Description:
We all like games, but the problem is most of them can't be played alone.  And war games are the worst, because they have long set-up times, in addition to needing at least two people and a lot of pieces...So, lets make a war game to play by yourself.

-description from the designer

Lone General is a solitaire wargame.  The game assumes suitable unit figures are available.  The print-and-play rules provide a method of determining and distributing enemy units (all pre-defined), then having those units act/react from among established options.  Every game involves four armies and six fronts, offering multiple starting positions.  The game uses fairly simple rules to support movement, terrain, morale, rallying, and various other standard components of wargaming.

The game, fully developed in under 24-hours for a time-restricted design competition, has a few rough edges.

-user summary

Name: Terror Town RPG
Description:
Terror Town RPG is a simple solo game wherein all rules of gameplay are included in a single character sheet. In the game, the player takes the role of a person trapped in the evil Terror Town, a ghost town whose legend claims a corrupt mayor sacrificed the souls of his entire town in order to gain power and eternal life in a dark dimension of pure evil. Now, the town exists in three different worlds at once: Our World, Grey World, and Dark World. In our world, you will find weapons and other useful items. In Dark World, you will find twisted monsters out to kill you. In Grey World, you will find both. Can you survive the survival horror challenge of Terror Town? Will you escape the doomed town, defeat it’s diabolical mayor, or just end up falling victim to it’s many monsters? The answer awaits you... in Terror Town.

—description from the publisher

Despite its name, Terror Town RPG is not a role-playing game.  The procedural, solitaire game is played in a series of turns, each turn presenting a challenge to overcome.  If successful, a random die roll determines what the next turn will bring.  The player starts with two pools of points - Escape and Life - which vary during play.  Escape points are used to avoid certain situations; Life points are depleted by failure.  If Life ever reaches zero, the game is lost - otherwise the game ends in success when the player escapes Terror Town.

The print-and-play game rules are presented in tiny typeface on a single page of paper; three pages of cut-out tokens also are provided.

—user summary

Name: Firefly: The Game – Loot Crate: Regina Promo Card
Description:
Regina Loot Crate promo card supplied with Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats.

This card is from the Osiris Shipworks Deck and is played as follows:

Remove from play to use: Draw a card from the Regina Supply Deck. If it is a Gear Card, keep it. If not, discard it and draw another card. Repeat until a Gear Card is drawn

Name: Firefly: The Game – Loot Crate: Space Bazaar Promo Card
Description:
Space Bazaar Loot Crate promo card supplied with Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats.

This card is from the Regina Deck and is played as follows:

Remove from play to use: Draw a card from the Space Bazaar Supply Deck. If it is a Gear Card, keep it. If not, discard it and draw another card. Repeat until a Gear Card is drawn

Name: Firefly: The Game – Loot Crate: Osiris Promo Card
Description:
Osiris Loot Crate promo card supplied with Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats.

This card is from the Silverhold Deck and is played as follows:

Remove from play to use: Draw a card from the Osiris Supply Deck. If it is a Gear Card, keep it. If not, discard it and draw another card. Repeat until a Gear Card is drawn

Name: Firefly: The Game – Loot Crate: Persephone Promo Card
Description:
Persephone Loot Crate promo card supplied with Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats.

This card is from the Space Bazaar Deck and is played as follows:

Remove from play to use: Draw a card from the Persephone Supply Deck. If it is a Gear Card, keep it. If not, discard it and draw another card. Repeat until a Gear Card is drawn

Name: Dragon Dice: Eldarim Expansion – Dragonkin
Description:
This is the dragonkin expansion. Text on the back of the box:

The mysterious Eldarim have begun to teach their singular elemental skills to a few chosen Acolytes, who have abandoned their species traditions to become a new species in Esfah. Your battles will be enhanced by using the powerful Dragonmasters and Dragonhunters, the single-element Acolytes of the Eldarim, and the protective Dragonkin whose elemental nature links them with the Eldarim.

Eldarim Expansion: Dragonkin; Box contains 6 common dragonkin, 3 uncommon dragonkin, 2 rare dragonkin, and 1 dragonkin champion in a random assortment of types and colors.

Name: Dragon Dice: Eldarim Expansion – Dragoncrusader / Dragonzealots
Description:
Dragonzealots- These powerful warriors are strong enough to control the wild dragons. The Crusaders protect their armies with their mighty shields. Five colors-black, blue, gold, green, and red. This item is for a set of each of the five different colors, plus the white Dragoncrusader.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information.

Name: Dragon Dice: Eldarim Expansion – Dragonlord / Dragonmasters
Description:
Dragonmasters - Dragonmasters are 4-health units that are part of the Eldarim species and come in five different colors, but are virtually identical to the Dragonlord.  They have several advantages and disadvantages when compared to the Dragonlord. The Dragonmaster can only cast magic of the same color as itself.  Dragonmasters can carry medallions and magical items matching their color. A Dragonmaster can tame dragons of the same color if it rolls its SFR Logo during the dragon attack. During the retreat step of a reserve movement, a Dragonmaster can "ride" a tamed dragon to any other terrain. A Dragonmaster's logo acts as a 2-point ID.

A Dragonlord can do all the same as a Dragonmaster, but it works on any color dragon (including white dragons). It can cast any color of magic. It's logo does nothing in a normal army roll.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information

Name: Dragon Dice: Eldarim Expansion – Dragonslayer/Dragonhunters
Description:
Dragonhunters- These secretive warriors live to battle the evil dragons. Not just powerful fighters, the Hunters can protect the armies with which they seek glory. Five colors-black, blue, gold, green, and red. This item is for a set of each of the five different colors, plus the white Dragonslayer.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information.

Name: Dragon Dice: Medallion
Description: Medallions- The mystic medallions are metallic magic items which can be carried by any unit. They provide powerful abilities to the army fortunate enough to hold one. Three alloys-gold, silver, and bronze.

Name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Dracolem Champion Promo
Description: This promotional die is an alternate version of the Draco-Champion, the Special Action Icon 'Major Gate' has been replaced with the SFR Inc. company logo. A Draco-Champion is the Heavy Melee Champion of the lost Dracolem species. Before they suddenly vanished from Esfah the Dracolem were sentient alloy based golems created in ancient times by the Gnomes to mimic and improve the native Dragonkin beasts. The Draco-Champion is packed full of special action icons which deal both powerful melee attacks against your opponents as well as save against damage done to it!

Name: Ghosts Love Candy: Kidthulhu Promo
Description:
Promo Kid Card (100) included when ordering base game from Steve Jackson.

5
While KIDTHULHU is in the neighborhood, turn order is resolved from lowest to highest after players reveal their selected ghosts.

Name: Ghosts Love Candy: Chicken Promo
Description:
Promo Kid Card (101) included when ordering base game from Steve Jackson.

20
If the CHICKEN is still in the neighborhood at the end of the game, the last player who haunted her may take 1 candy from any kid in the neighborhood.

Name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Elemental Relic
Description:
RELICS

Relics are large, non-elemental, metalic six-sided items. These ancient items are created from Eldrymetallum, a metal not native to Esfah.

Relics adhere to the same rules as items, described above, with two exceptions: 
- As Relics are non-elemental, any unit may carry and use a Relic.
- A Relic is considered to be two items for the purposes of how many items a unit can carry and use.

Elemental Relic
- When rolled with an army, the Elemental Relic icon indicates which element units must contain to be affected by the relic. The SFR Logo contains all elements and ivory. 
- Multiple Elemental Relics in an army may cancel each other. Elemental Relics that roll the same element have no effect on that roll. Note that the SFR logo matches all elements.

Elemental Relic  
During any non-maneuver roll, X health-worth of matching units in the army carrying this relic may be re-rolled once, ignoring the previous result, OR, you may recruit or promote X health-worth of matching units from your DUA to the army carrying this relic. Results may be split between recruiting, promoting, and re-rolling in any way you choose. Any promotions happen all at once.

Name: Ro Sham Bo
Description:
Venture into the world of Ro Sham Bo.

The two player strategic board game where you collect wondrous artifacts to outwit your opponent and defeat them in battle.

There are two types of Artifacts to choose from, tactfully traverse the board to collect these artifacts and use their power to give you positioning and combat advantages.

Combat is engaged in close quarters through an attack and then counter phase.

Use the Artifacts you collected to tactically turn tables.  The true spirit is being able to chain these artifacts with one another.

Do you have what it takes to go hand to hand?

—description from the publisher

Name: Les Trois Portails
Description:
LES TROIS PORTAILS is a game of medium complexity, a wargame in which you are the hero! It allows you to relive the epic of the Land of Alhandra, more exactly, the invasion of the chaos it undergoes by opening 3 magic portals.

With a 16-page booklet of illustrated rules and scenario add-ons, a system inspired by that of ARS BELLUM, but introducing characters, magic, objects, flyers and monsters, it is fully immersed in the Heroic-Fantasy world.

The Land of Alhandra is made up of ancient races (men, greenhorns, dwarves, elves) who are experiencing the rebirth of the forces of Darkness, embodied by the Lich King Alach Zhur, and the invasion of chaos.

The player delivers the battles of the scenarios on A4 cards (A3 later) that make up "The Great Campaign" (the story of the invasion of chaos).

The game is played in pairs, one game lasts about 1 to 2 hours. You can choose to embody one side or the other (Darkness or Empire), or alternate roles. Each scenario is independent and constitutes a small battle, but it is also a stage in the story that is told to you.

The units (leaders or combat units) have a movement and combat capability (possibly including firepower) and represent 500 to 1000 or 2000 men, a dozen or twenty monsters, an illustrious character or hero.

The system is based on the initiative conquered by players following a die roll and the impact of leaders and/or other modifiers in the scenario. Scenario speed and ease of understanding are favored. The player starts with basic units, he enriches his pool as the scenario progresses with other units, additional spells and characters.

In THE THREE PORTALS, the system is based on the skills of the units that bring the player's character or armies, and on the development of his main character or armies.

The basic module of the game gives the essential rules and the scenarios are the preamble of the story; the extensions are groupings of scenarios around one or more new features (new race, new characters, additions of objects or various attributes).
A general map in the basic module will be completed as the game progresses.

Usually, extensions include 4 additional battles, a counter board, additional maps, items, spells, the author works on additional locations.

The rulebook
16 pages of illustrated rules, simple concepts and fun play system effectively allowing the simulation of historical dimension of battles.
 —description from the publisher (translated)

Participez à une épopée fantastique sur la terre d'Alhandra ! Accomplissez les desseins des forces des ténèbres, ou prenez en main le destin de l'Empire et des races anciennes... Un wargame dont VOUS êtes le héros !

Le livret de règles 
16 pages de règles illustrées, des concepts simples et la possibilité de jouer avec plaisir tout en simulant avec efficacité la dimension historique des batailles

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: BlackOut
Description:
"A difficult job needs the best worker"
BlackOut P&P, you need to find an electrical coordinator capable of maintaining stability in the electrical power system and avoiding a blackout.

Name: Trivia Trolls
Description:
The first party trivia game that embarrasses your friends through the art of trolling.

On each turn, one person draws a clue card and reads the category to their teammates. The teammates select the clue difficulty they want, 1 point being easy, 2 points being medium, and 3 points being hard.

The opposing team then has the opportunity to play a troll card or a trap card to add an extra layer of difficulty. Troll cards are played face up. They can make players do things like “sing the clue in their best opera voice,” “read the clue while smiling through clenched teeth,” “read the clue in their best Australian accent” “read the clue with a mouthful of water” or “text the clue using only emojis” to name just a few. Trap cards are played face down and revealed after the clue is read. They can make teams skip turns or lose points.

If a troll card or trap card is played, the answering team has the opportunity to play defense with a trench card. Trench cards can negate troll and trap cards, award extra points or give extra turns.

Once all troll, trap, or trench cards have been played for the round. The clue is read, hilarity ensues, points are awarded (or not) and then the next team draws their clue. The first team to 11 points wins! Let the trolling commence!

Happy Trolling friends!

—description from the publisher

Name: JELL-O Jiggler Slap Game
Description:
"LEFT HAND... LIME!" Listen for the JELL-O flavor that's read out loud, then be the quickest to slap your hand-- the CORRECT hand-- on the corresponding JELL-O Jiggler card.  
If a "Jiggle!" card is called out, you must jiggle and wiggle for the flavor you savor. You'll love this quick-thinking, hand-slapping game from everyone's favorite jiggly treat. There's always room for this JELL-O gelatin game!

—description from the back of the box

This is one of the three games included in the "Variety Game Pack" box from Big G Creative.

Name: Explore: Tomb of Rasha
Description:
Co-op game for 2 players (can be played solo)
Tomb of Rasha is a cooperative game where you have to explore a tomb in a team of 2 players and defeat the snake queen Rasha. The game is played with a 54-card deck.

Story:
After the kingdom of Falladin defeated the evil snake queen Rasha, her creatures buried her deep into a tomb. There she lies for centuries, almost forgotten to the outside world. Until creatures of the depth came crawling out of the tomb and disturbed the nearby kingdom. Two adventurers where asked to go into the tomb to see what has happened. For it seems that Rasha might have awakened.

Name: KRAFT Macaroni & Cheese Game
Description:
Satisfy your cravings with the KRAFT Macaroni & Cheese Game! Roll the dice and add them together, then play the noodle cards that match. Keep an eye on Cheesasaurus Rex as he boosts his way higher up the Noodle Meter, but make sure you don't run out of noodles! The first person to play all of their cards OR the last person with leftover noodles is the mac & cheese winner! It's cheesy goodness your family will love!

—description from the back of the box

This is one of the three games included in the "Variety Game Pack" box from Big G Creative.

Name: HEINZ Ketchup Dice Game
Description:
Roll the dice and collect as much ketchup as possible to try and score 57 points! But beware, if you get too greedy for the taste of HEINZ ketchup you could lose everything! Mustard and Sweet Relish bring an added level of flavor to the game, but can serve as penalties in your quest to roll the best. It's HEINZ ketchup or BUST in this press your luck game of risk versus reward! America's Favorite Ketchup game is definitely worth the wait.

—description from the back of the box

This is one of the three games included in the "Variety Game Pack" box from Big G Creative.

Name: Clue: Riverdale
Description:
The idyllic town of Riverdale has a secret. You must discover WHO killed Jason Blossom, WHAT weapon they used, and WHERE they killed him. Take on the roles of your favorite Riverdale characters to solve the mystery.

Contents:
    Custom Game Board
    6 Suspect Movers
    6 Personality Cards
    21 Rumor cards
    18 Intrigue Cards
    Custom Score pad
    Envelope
    6 Custom Zinc Tokens
    2 Dice
    Rules

-description from publisher's website
Families: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

Name: 1942 Flip Roll & Write
Description:
During the Pacific War of World War II our fighter will have to destroy the Japanese air fleet located in one of Japan's most important cities, but during the trip we will encounter enemy aircraft that will try to thwart our mission.

1942 is a flip & write where you must defeat different enemies that come out of a deck of cards.

With a few scroll mechanisms, new cards will appear and disappear at the same time.

Your mission is to make the maximum number of points by defeating planes, ships and other enemies, until you reach the enemy base and destroy it.

During the game, bonuses may appear on the cards that will give you combos or new weapons.

The final objective is to reach Tokyo with the highest possible score.

The game can be played in solo or 2-player mode.

The game is available in Print & Play.

-description from designer

Name: Carcosa Rising
Description:
Carcosa Rising is the first expansion for Four against the Great Old Ones. It is based mainly on Mythos-related materials from Chambers and Bierce, drawn directly from the original sources.

The disturbances caused by the upcoming Great Ritual have started to tear apart the fabric of reality, and well-known places have already been replaced by a distorted version of themselves coming from other dimensions. Meanwhile, the King in Yellow and its agent, the Pallid Mask, are manipulating events from behind the curtain, and poisoning the very thoughts of unsuspecting people. And who is the mysterious plump man that appears to be following the group?

Carcosa Rising includes a new Investigator class (the Dreamer), three alternative versions of locations from the basic game, an entire new location (Carcosa), three event tables for traveling, possible attacks from the Pallid Mask (who takes control of the body of Investigators gone Insane), and a final Encounter with the King in Yellow.

This is a non-standalone expansion. Players can choose to add any combination of elements from Carcosa Rising to the base game, mixing and matching materials to ensure that no two games will be the same.

—description from the publisher

Name: Thinkers: Причина и Следствие
Description:
Set #4: "Cause and Effect" of the Thinkers series of board games will allow children of primary school age to learn to draw logical conclusions in various non-standard situations. The skills obtained as a result of the game will not only increase social adaptability but also lay the foundation for further personal development. Most of the items on the cards in this set are short stories that tell the background of a fact. The players are asked to determine exactly why this or that consequence took place, and what was its cause. Here are just a few examples of the 100 tasks that players will have to solve in this set:

- In which country are only men citizens?
- In the English city of Bradford, there is the only farm in the world where samples of woolen fabrics are delivered from all UK textile factories. Who is bred on this farm?
“What is the use of a tape recorder of a tiger's growl at Bombay Airport?
- In the American state of Arizona, they began to protect the desert from thieves. They steal something without which the desert is threatened with desolation and devastation. what is taken out of the desert?
- Walter Scott said: "Both the crystal and the heart would not be so valuable if ..."

Any number of participants can play the Thinkers board game, but if there are a large number of players, it would be advisable to split into teams. The teams, in turn, take one card with the task, which indicates the topic, difficulty, i.e. the number of victory points, and the task itself. After that, all team members jointly begin the discussion. The complexity of the tasks varies from one to five points, so the developer recommends to allot from 3 to 15 minutes to find solutions, respectively. The team can check the correctness of its answer on the reverse side of the card, then move on to the next team. At the request of the participants, the game can last for a certain time or end immediately after one of the teams scores a predetermined number of points.

Name: Градус
Description:
Degree: competition for adults only!
Board Game Box Degree Want to diversify your party or any gathering in your home of up to ten people who are already 18 years old? Maybe you just need to liberate the participants of your corporate team building?

With the board game Gradus, you will not only diversify your fun but also get an unforgettable sensation and experience with a touch of the piquancy of adult competition. But what can I say: the roof will blow away completely from jokes, gags, eroticism, and alcohol. Everyone will play the board game Gradus because you simply won't be able to get out!

Hit the table with a Degree!
Before the start, all players receive tablets, presented by the designer in the form of beer mugs, and tokens with the volume of alcohol consumed to record their achievements in conventional alcoholic drinks. Do you want to be limited to conventional alcohol and liters? Prepare thoroughly: a few bottles of pleasure and a good snack will not be superfluous. Companies of teetotalers can simply eat well and drink tea.

The set includes 6 decks of cards with different themes:
Basic - it is also basic and participates in all mixes;
Alkotresh - the name speaks for itself, so the tasks are tied to the "alcohol" part;
Move your body - tasks from this deck will crush your bodies sitting at the table;
Tin - the special coolness of the tasks will blow anyone's mind;
Spicy - a little eroticism will not hurt;
Brain ON - don't want to move your body - move your brains. Components of the game Degree

It is recommended to use no more than three task decks in one game party, shuffling two more decks from the base one if desired. A menu with a standard section and a part of wishes is also available for players.

The goal of each player is to reach the liter or two-liter value on their tablet by drinking or drinking points. Points are awarded after completing a specific task.

So, you are in an entertainment establishment, and just burn with the desire to drink! Wait for your turn and, in the clockwise direction, make a move: take a card from the general deck and announce your task to all participants. If you successfully complete the task, you will receive a point by noting the amount taken internally on the tablet. Please note that if you refuse to fulfill the conditions, then you drink a free "penalty" for which points are not awarded.

During the game, you can use the menu once and drink your points to order any dish for another participant. The standard section is available at any time during the game, and the Wish Menu is available after completing the task. If the victim of your choice did not complete the task, then, like all losers, he drinks a "penalty", while receiving the right to use the Menu for free.

The board game Degree can be adapted to suit any company by using suitable decks, making some decks suitable for families as well.

Name: GEMJI
Description:
The legend says that in the year 2349, an adventurous young man hacked into the head of a Gemji prince - the most secretive and thriving high-class caste, unveiling a very well-kept secret. He stumbled upon a mysterious board game they used to train their children. Once the hacker reconstructed the abstract game, he revealed an ingenious system for learning various life concepts. The people who played & learned through this framework became wiser, stronger, and more capable, helping the nation become the most powerful on Earth. Nowadays, this "game" is known simply as GEMJI. The hacker changed the future once, and now it's your turn. Game on!

GEMJI is a modular game system made of 70 double-sided magnetic tiles that give you the freedom to play multiple games. Games include original titles developed by the GEMJI team, educational games, and popular classic game adaptations.

Just like a standard deck of cards, the GEMJI System offers multiple games in one set. The big difference is that GEMJI could be used in many more situations and combinations, which means MORE games! The magnetic grid, the double-face tactile interface, the unique design language, and 3D build options make GEMJI unbeatable.

Over 30 pre-made games exist currently, and more will continuously be added.

—description from the designer

Name: GRBLD
Description:
Each round in GRBLD, players draft letter cards to build words in a given category. Players draft only consonants, with vowels being free! Once the words have been built, players drop the words on their sheet. The first word will still make sense, but then things get GRBLD!

Players score by filling rows, marking off the alphabet, filling a "combo bar" by placing vowels in the correct spaces, and stacking the same consonants on each other. Via the combo bar, players unlock great powers to use, such as the "letterbomb" and the ability to use both letters on a card or even to make two words in a round.

By using various powers, players get to experience satisfying explosive turns in which they rack up both words and points. However, peak too early and risk running out of space for your words; peak too late, and risk not being able to make optimal use of your powers.

—description from the publisher

Name: Knock Knock! First Words
Description:
Knock Knock! Who is it?
... It's Knock Knock! First words - a brand new game created for babies (yes babies!), toddlers and up!

There's fun behind every door in this card game with 7 different ways to play.  Knock on the door and see who's there, learn new words, match cards, make sets, play memory pairs and more!  Each card is illustrated by Parker Jacobs (designer behind the preschool hit Yo Gabba Gabba!) into 4 familiar sets (food, toys, animals and clothes) giving you new ways to bond with your children.

Knock Knock! first words is the first in a range of card games designed to grow with your family.  The games and activities are suitable for different stages of development and can be played by children of different ages at the same time.

7 in 1 games and activities for 1 - 4 players aged 0+ to 3+.  (6 are co-operative, 1 competitive.)  The colourful, A6 sized laminated cards are designed for little hands and made from FSC card in the UK.  (Single use plastic free.)

—description from designer

Name: Rainbow Elf
Description:
From 2 to 6 players face each other in games of 15 to 30 minutes, indicated from the age of 6. Through simple and intuitive rules, they will interact with the village, the forest and the sky. Each goblin has its own ability, based on its color, to use for its own benefit or to annoy others.

—user summary
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: UkeSeme!: Sono Uke o Semeru no wa Ore da
Description:
UkeSeme! is a game themed around BL (boys' love, IE male x male romantic) manga themes and tropes. It is a quick-playing, simple game. Players hold cards with different archetypal BL character types-- Idol singer, high school student, butler, etc-- and take turns pairing them together. Players then discuss why they feel this pairing of characters works, and scenarios with them, to try to convince the judge to accept the pair. Alternatively, there is no single judge, and the group votes instead, but the rules are otherwise the same.

—user summary

Name: Festival!
Description:
In days of yore, the dreariness and difficulty of daily living was interrupted by celebrations filled with feasting and festivity. Your goal is to collect cards and build sets of percussion and melodic instruments, female and male choirs, and to finish in first place at the yearly festival. Watch out for opponents stealing your performers and being left off the stage. Oh, and dragons.

Festival! is a musical, set-building game for the entire family. Like most Tamed Beast Games, it is a high-player count game, with up to 7 players.

Gameplay:

In turn, players move one adjacent location on the map (Palace, City, Village, and Country) collecting Ensemble cards to form sets. Cards may be played and scored in the City, while Palace cards add bonuses and special powers. Four times per game there is a festival at which players may move onto a stage and get bonus Finale cards. The fourth festival signals the end of the game and the Festival Finale. Finale card points are added to points scored throughout the game and a winner declared. They are encouraged to sing a victory song.

Name: Naruto: Ninja Arena – Genin Pack Expansion
Description:
The Chûnin exams are in full swing! With the expansion of Naruto Ninja Arena, you can now have a greater choice of characters and play with up to 6 players! This is a great opportunity for Rock Lee, Tenten, Hinata, Kiba, Temari and Gaara to join Naruto, Sasuke, Sakura and Shikamaru to spar in frenzied bouts and practice mastery of their TECHNIQUES and special POWERS.

The young Ninjas will use their skills to the best of their ability and try to bring down their rivals by inflicting DAMAGE that will add up to WOUNDS, KNOCKOUTS or even worse, final elimination. The last Ninja standing wins!

Naruto Ninja Arena is the first game using the Roll & Clash system. During the game, you throw your dice as quickly as you can and use the results to activate Techniques without stopping the game. Everyone plays at the same time in a frantic battle to be the last Ninja Standing!

The game ends when all players are K.O. or eliminated except one. The last player standing wins the game!

Name: Fences: The Ranch
Description:
Fences has expanded its acreage so you won't run out of new things to do on The Ranch! You can now raise chickens, but watch out for the sly fox! You can ride a horse, drive tractors, and even sell your animals at the market: Don't make hasty decisions, though! You have the ability to store animals allowing you to increase your points at the optimal time.  Open and close gates to change the size of your fields so you'll never run out of room!  With nine new expansions, there are plenty of ways to have fun with Fences at the Ranch!

-description from designer

Name: Banco Imobiliário
Description:
Brazilian version of Monopoly from 2020 (product code 2000) with free app available for smartphones and tablets with Android and IOS.

This is a physical product with optional app to increase the experience. Can be played with the classic rules or adding the app.

Name: Team Yankee: NATO's First Line – NATO Tank Company
Description:
NATO's troops stand ready on the border awaiting the Soviet onslaught, confident in their abilities and equipment they have been given.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Team Yankee: Durand's Devils – French Rapid Action Group
Description:
Durand's Devils is a great way to begin building your French force with three AMX-30 tanks and two Gazelle helicopters, it provides some fantastic models that can fill many roles in your army.

—description from the publisher

Name: Between the Sticks Football: General Manager
Description:
This is a free PnP Game designed for the 2020 Solitaire PnP Contest.  Assets available in the files link.***

You are the General Manager of a new American Football team who needs to sign all 22 starters to your roster while staying under budget.  Build a balanced championship level team and win.

All players are on individual mini playing cards and have a preferred salary & stat scores for 10 critical football traits like passing, blocking, & tackling.  When deciding to sign a player, you place them into a starting spot on the game board which values 3 of the 10 traits. The player's scores will generate one of 4 types of victory points (Toughness, Explosiveness, Intelligence and Skill).  You win by keeping these 4 victory point totals in balance while assembling a skillful team.

With a salary cap of $500MM, you need to decide who to sign, how much to pay & what they will contribute to your overall team.  Do you have the vision needed to assemble a champion?

Designed by Joe Fontana (Formulaic Games)

—description from the designer

Name: The Thing: Norwegian Outpost
Description:
This expansion for The Thing - The Boardgame allows you to experience the events that happened at Thule Station, the Norwegian station where it all began! As for the 1982 version, the expansion lets you relive the tensest moments from the story, transporting you into the cinematic film!

The core element of the game is based on the emulation properties of the Thing, which will hide its identity under a blanket of fake humanity, but with substantial differences in the way they interact with the game and with your feelings.

Here are the key points of the expansion:

     A new board, new characters, and new materials.
     A new end game condition represented by the escape of the dog that will arrive at Outpost 31. IF this happens, you can play your next game of the 1982 version with a pack leader dog (a dog that behaves differently throughout the game).
     A new element in the game: teeth! The Thule Station crew discovers that the Alien cannot assimilate and duplicate metal parts, so dental fillings become a way to find out if a person is definitely human, but not if they are alien. The test with the wire and the flamethrower disappears and flashlights are added with which it will be possible to carry out a test and look at the teeth of the other characters, checking for the presence or lack of fillings.
     A new location is available for the Thing: The UFO! It represents the last hope of escape for the Thing, as in the movie. The final confrontation with any remaining humans will take place here. Of course, this is only an option, and just like the dog escape mentioned above, it doesn't necessarily happen! Everything will depend on your behavior, as you can win or lose in many ways!


In the 2011 film, as soon as they found out what's going on, people's behavior becomes more selfish, trying by all means to save their own lives. We therefore decided to try to include the possibility of a solitary escape, an element that will bring the level of distrust to the maximum! This also brings new mechanics, such as the ability to voluntarily sabotage vehicles even if you are human.
 The expansion will contain: a new board, new characters, new cards and new tokens.

—description from the publisher

Name: ASCII Planets
Description:
ASCII Planets is an open source board game--written in LaTeX--in which 1–7 players lead an entire planet through the modern age into a warp-capable civilization by advancing Technology and Culture, training Population, constructing Starships, and interacting through Trade or inter-planetary conquest.

—description from the designer

Name: Persephone
Description:
In the traditional, diagonal form of Checkers, pieces are restricted to playing on a single color of the checkerboard. Thus it is possible to play two games simultaneously on the same board. The first game is played on the Dark squares, and the second game on the Light squares.

Also, the conventional way of playing two games simultaneously is that the player makes a move in the first game, then another move in the second game. However, in 'Persephone' the player picks between either of the two games in which he wants to move a piece. Captures still take precedence over any other move. So a player is forced to make a capture on a particular side of the board if possible.

A player wins when he manages to capture all of his opponents pieces that are on the same color of the checkerboard - either all the Light pieces or all the Dark pieces. With two games at once, the chances of a draw are greatly reduced. If one of the games is undecided, the other game can still be resolved for the win.

The two sides are Iron and Gold. Instead of pieces being referred to as Men and Kings, they are known as Maidens and Queens.

Other than this, the game follows the rules of Spanish Checkers. This is played very much like Anglo-American Checkers, the main difference is that the Queen has a more substantial move along any number of vacant squares, including ones beyond a captured piece. Captures are mandatory. If a player has a choice of captures he must take the greater number of pieces.

Name: The Heist: The Museum of Fine Art
Description:
The thief moves invisibly through the museum stealing art, disabling security cameras, avoiding the museum staff and attempting to escape before being cornered. The thief player has a privacy screen, a pad of mini maps to plot their course, locations of art and security cameras on, a thief token that gets placed on the game board if spotted by a museum staff player and two custom dice which are used to determine if an exit has been successfully unlocked. There are 4 thieves to choose from each with a unique skill.

The museum staff coordinate in order to detect and detain the thief before the thief can unlock an exit and escape the museum. The museum staff players roll a standard D6 to move their tokens around the game board, checking rooms "visually" or by checking on 1 of 12 security cameras to track, locate and corner the thief. They can also access the IT room to check and or repair all the cameras.

The game ends when either the thief has been caught or the thief has managed to escape the museum with at least 1 piece of art.

The box contains a quad fold game board, the instructions, a privacy screen, a 100 sheet pad of mini maps, 16 pieces of fine art, 15 art stands, 6 museum staff tokens, 6 museum staff cards, 1 thief token, 12 security cameras, 1 D6, 1 thief exit die, and 1 Lucky Leo thief exit die. The characters represent a variety of ages, genders and ethnic groups.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fairy Tale Files: The Cinderella Murders
Description:
A grisly double-murder shocks Fairy Tale Land! Lady Tremaine and one of her two daughters are found stabbed at the manor. The prime suspect is the mistreated stepdaughter Cinderella - she had motive and opportunity. Could it be that simple?

Collect the clues and solve the puzzles to find out!

The Fairy Tale Files are lighthearted murder mystery detective games inspired by iconic fairy tales. We bring  you the delight of your favorite childhood stories with an adult twist! Join the Magical Mishaps Agency to solve the clues and find the killer!

—description from the publisher

Name: Waste Diggers: Animal Companions for Five Klicks From the Zone
Description:
With this expansion pack for Five Klicks From the Zone you can add an animal companion to your squad. The Waste Digger is a dog..lizard...thing.. that thrives in the wasteland and gives you both the opportunity to employ a new, somewhat unusual type of squad member and to convert and paint a fun model.

On the battle field, the Waste Digger is perfectly suited to zip forward and chew up wayward enemies or to rush in to help someone in trouble. Just watch out, as they are fairly vulnerable to fire.

This is an expansion and requires a copy of Five Klicks From the Zone to play.

Name: Monopoly: Riverdale
Description:
Welcome to MONOPOLY: Riverdale, a place where nothing is as it seems. Buy, sell and trade your way through the town from Pop’s Chock’lit Shoppe (home of milkshakes, meetings and murder) to the mysterious Sisters of Quiet Mercy (the mysterious locale with secrets all its own). Choose from custom sculpted tokens like Archie’s Guitar or Veronica’s Pearls, and show your inner Blossom trying to bankrupt your friends and win it all!

Includes
Custom Game Board
6 Custom tokens: Archies’s Guitar, Veronica’s Pearls, Betty’s Diary, Cheryl’s Spider Brooch, Jughead’s Hat, Pop’s Milkshake
Houses and Hotels
Community Chest and Chance cards
Custom Monopoly money
Rules

-description from publisher's website

Name: Monopoly: Hallmark Channel
Description:
Gather your family & friends to play this special Hallmark Channel edition of MONOPOLY®. You’ll be transported right into the picturesque world of Hallmark Channel as you travel around the board and buy, sell and trade properties inspired by everything you love about the network. Whether you’re buying a Christmas Tree Farm or a Bed & Breakfast, building cottages and inns, or getting out of jail free because you started a prison knitting club, you’ll experience all the thrills of this classic game in an entirely new way!

Includes:
Gameboard
6 collectible tokens
28 title deed cards
16 Home cards
16 Family cards
2 dice
32 cottages
32 inns
1 pack of custom Hallmark Channel money
Rules

-description from publisher's website

Name: Monopoly: Breaking Bad
Description:
Players will want to “tread lightly” to buy, sell, and trade properties to be the last one standing in this risky version of Monopoly based on AMC’s hit series Breaking Bad! Familiar locations and tokens based on iconic items from the show such as Heisenberg Hat, RV, Tio’s Bell and more will take fans back through the sordid evolution of Walter White and his own capitalistic plan.

Includes:

1 Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens: Heisenberg Hat, Tio’s Bell, Money Barrel, Gas Mask, Pink Teddy Bear, RV
32 Houses renamed Tented Houses
12 Hotels renamed SuperLabs
16 Community Chest Cards renamed Heisenberg Cards
16 Chance Cards renamed Walter White Cards
Custom themed money
2 Dice
Rules

—description from the publisher's website
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Turf War! Gangland Violence During Prohibition
Description:
Turf War: Gangland Violence during Prohibition  is a tabletop wargame of gangsters and gun molls. 
 Each player is the boss of a gang of hardened criminals intent on taking over the Turf of their rivals.  
The game can be played stand alone, but includes a comprehensive campaign system that includes Turf, Income, Injury, Experience, Gang building and more.

The core game play mechanics revolve around using your gangsters dice pools appropriately to gain your objectives.  All dice rolls are opposed rolls looking for a Target Number, the model with the most successes wins.  
However, use your dice pool carefully so you do not run out of key dice when you need them most!

Welcome to the mean streets of Turf War. 

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: My Hero Academia
Description:
Build your hero team in MONOPOLY: My Hero Academia! Make your way across the board choosing between Class 1-A’s best and brightest, including fan favorite students and teachers. Draw from Go Beyond! and Plus Ultra! decks to advance your team, but make sure to avoid Detention!

Includes:
    6 Custom Tokens featuring Eraserhead’s Visor, Grenade Glove, Deku’s Mask, Dummy Bomb, Shigaraki’s Hand, UA Sigil
    Custom Designed Game Board
    Houses & Hotels renamed Rewards & Trophies
    Custom Chance & Community Chest Cards renamed Go Beyond! & Plus Ultra!
    Custom themed MONOPOLY money
    Rules

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Monopoly: Godzilla Monster Edition
Description:
Demolish the competition in a city-terrorizing twist on the classic board game with MONOPOLY®: Godzilla. Begin the invasion by buying, selling and trading locations like Monster Island, Goro’s Workshop, and Kitakami Lake and take over the board with Facilities and Bases. Custom sculpted tokens of giants such as Mothra, Godzilla, King Ghidorah, and Mechagodzilla easily impose on anything in their path!

Includes:
1 Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens: Godzilla, Mothra, King Ghidorah, Minilla, Mechagodzilla, Rodan
28 Title Deed Cards
32 Houses renamed FACILITIES
12 Hotels renamed BASES
16 UNGCC Cards
16 GODZILLA TOWER Cards
1 Pack of Kaiju Credit Currency
2 Dice
Rules

-description from publisher's website

Name: Plonk !
Description:
Plonk is a game of bluff and fun, with friends or family.
How to play ?
1- Three kangaroos and eleven cards each (six numbered 2 to 7, two Plonk! And three paw prints).
2- Shuffle your cards, uncover one, and call a number, or Plonk! to jump further! You can try the bluff, but beware, when you come across a paw print, you will have to lie!
3- If no one challenges you, move on! Otherwise, reveal your card. You lied? Hop, back! Did you tell the truth? Go ahead! and it is those who have doubted your sincerity who recoil!
4- At the end, everyone counts their points on the board.

A game that will make you jump with pleasure!

—description from the publisher (translated)


Plonk est un jeu de bluff et rigolade, en famille ou entre adultes
Comment jouer ?
1- Trois kangourous et onze cartes chacun (six numérotées de 2 à 7, deux Plonk ! et trois empreintes de pattes).
2- Mélangez vos cartes, découvrez-en une, et annoncez un chiffre, ou alors Plonk ! pour sauter plus loin ! Vous pouvez tenter le bluff, mais attention, lorsque vous tombez sur une empreinte de patte, vous serez obligé de mentir!
3- Si personne ne vous conteste, avancez ! Sinon, dévoilez votre carte. Vous aviez menti ? Hop, en arrière ! Vous aviez dit la vérité ? Allez, en avant ! et ce sont ceux qui ont douté de votre sincérité qui reculent !
4- A la fin, chacun compte ses points sur le plateau.

Un jeu qui vous fera bondir de plaisir !

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: The Goonies
Description:
“Never say die!” with MONOPOLY: The Goonies! Go on a quest for One-Eyed Willy’s hidden treasure and buy, sell, and trade locations around Astoria, Oregon in this version based on the classic 80s adventure movie! Play with collectible tokens such as Chester Copperport’s Key, the Gold Doubloon, and other memorable items while you try to be the last player with loot!

Includes:
    1 Game Board
    6 Collectible Tokens: Little Girl’s Bike, Copper Bones, Gold Doubloon, Statue of David, Willy’s Eye Patch, Skull and Crossed Bones
    28 Title Deed Cards
    16 Chance Cards renamed HEY YOU GUYS! Cards
    16 Community Chest Cards renamed NEVER SAY DIE Cards
    Custom Monopoly Money
    32 Houses renamed Booby Traps
    12 Hotels renamed Treasure Chests
    2 Dice
    Rules

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Monopoly: Garbage Pail Kids
Description:
Relive the classic trading card game in a whole new way with MONOPOLY: Garbage Pail Kids. Featuring authentic licensed characters fans know and love. Collectible tokens include the Zit Goo Tube, Melting Eyeball, and Swirly Dog Poop as players move around the board to collect the iconic Garbage Pail Kids.

Includes
    1 Game Board
    6 Collectible Tokens: Zit Goo Tube, Fish Bones, Melting Eyeball, Overflowing Trash Can, Guillotine, and Swirly Dog Poop
    28 Title Deed Cards
    16 Never had a Chance Cards
    16 Community Chester Cards
    Custom Monopoly Money
    32 Houses renamed GARBAGE CANS
    12 Hotels renamed DUMPSTERS
    2 Dice
    Rules

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Monopoly: Bob Ross Edition
Description:
“Take advantage of whatever happens” in the most peaceful edition of MONOPOLY you’ve ever seen! MONOPOLY: Bob Ross is your bravery test to buy, sell, and trade favorite works of art from The Joy of Painting series. Use collectible tokens to canvas the board as a Squirrel, Pine Tree, Easel, and more as you build up Cabins and Covered Bridges, shake off taxes, and beat the devil out of others’ budgets to be the last one standing with Happy Bucks!

Includes:
Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens
28 Title Deed Cards
16 Happy Little Accidents Cards
16 The Joy of Painting Cards
32 Houses renamed Cabins
12 Hotels renamed Covered Bridges
1 pack of Bob Ross Money
2 dice
Rules

-description from publisher's website

Name: Monopoly: Disney Lilo & Stitch
Description:
Say “aloha” to out-of-this-world adventure with Monopoly: Lilo & Stitch! Buy, sell and trade your favorite humble and beloved characters from the hit Disney movie in this tropical twist on the classic game. Face Galactic Federation odds and hula your way across the big island with Lilo, Nani, Stitch, and more of both alien and human kind to accumulate houses and hotels. It’s a Hawaiian rollercoaster ride to become the model citizen with the most riches, and “Ohana means family” so don’t get left behind!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Monopoly: Beetlejuice
Description:
Before you call his name three times, work your way through the strange and unusual afterlife of MONOPOLY: Beetlejuice! Buy, sell, and trade your favorite dark comedy characters such as Lydia, Delia, and Charles Dietz, Adam and Barbara Maitland, and the irreverent bio-exorcist himself to haggle the living daylights out of your competition and win with more than the “ghost with the most”! It’s showtime!

-description from publisher's website
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Gotta Get Outta This Space
Description:
Gotta Get Outta This Space is a print, play and post game for 1-4 players.

You're each stuck on a planet in the robot apocalypse, and one of the last human ships has just arrived in a nearby solar system!

To play, you'll have to print, find or make components for the game.

You'll then guide a spaceship through a few solar systems, with the goal of picking you up and Getting Outta This Space.

As the ship gets improved and damaged, you’ll change the board game components in front of you, writing on some pieces, destroying others, and making new ones with whatever materials you have on hand.

Once you've finished (assuming you do, in fact, get outta this space), you'll pack up the game and send it to someone else, who'll then do the same.

Together, you might just be able to stay alive and out of reach of the new robot overlords!

—description from the designer

Name: Skytear: Winterdeep
Description:
Signed in Skytear infused blood and writ upon animal skins, the pact of Winterdeep declares unity between Grialth and Xotlan.
VORHILD, the White Shade, is the first sign of their army. Her magic bow, a gift from Taulot’s champions, strikes silently and from afar, while her ermine friends swarm around her chosen prey.
The ancient queen NANTACA has been awoken from her overgrown tomb. The Monarch Unliving is back, and her followers, both the living and the dead, await her commands.
—description from the publisher

Name: Skytear: Stormsear
Description:
An Alliance forged by the fire of Kaeno and tempered by the winds of Utsesh, born to face the twin threats of Xotlan and Grialth.

Princess of a besieged land, KUMAYA, Ashen Maiden, fights to free her dominion once and for all. By using powers learnt from the Nuptians, she can imprison foes inside her mind palace.

SHAIDRUS, Last Light, defends its allies tirelessly using the sacred relic it used to protect. A statue animated by Divine will, all Utsesh and Kaeno has faith in its determinations.

—description from the publisher

Name: The 7th Citadel: The Unveilers
Description:
Commonly called "Unveilers", these magic-seeking ladybugs are as big as a fist but reputedly harmless, and are well-known among arcanists, treasure seekers, and other intrepid adventurers.

The Unveilers are attracted to magical emanations like flies to a rotting carcass. Spotting a cloud of these bugs is generally a good omen, but not everything that is imbued with magic is safe to dig up...

During your journey, you will certainly (Exploration card / random event) come across these ladybugs. When you do, you will put one of their miniatures into play on the Terrain card that you put in play after encountering this event. The ladybugs will remain there until you have either interacted with them (we won't tell you more, you'll have to find out for yourself) OR until you have dug to see what magical thing attracted them to the area. Then you will remove the mini and find out if you chose well… or poorly.

Will it be a powerful artifact? An arcane skeleton? A cursed object? A magical creature to fight or coax? All you have to do is dig to find out!

Name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Defence of Ryza
Description:
The forge world of Ryza is second only to Mars in its splendour. Famed for its innovative plasma technologies, it is a prime target for the Dark Mechanicum and their ally, the Warmaster Horus. As the forces of the traitor Fabricator-General, Kelbor-Hal, attack, Ryza's defenders prepare to sell their lives dearly for their world.

Discover the dramatic events of the Defence of Ryza in this 108-page hardback supplement for Adeptus Titanicus, alongside a host of new rules to use in your games. Harness the strengths of six different Titan Legions using four new maniples, and bring the might of six Knight Households to bear against your enemies. Create your own Legions, choosing from a massive variety of rules, and declare your allegiance to the Emperor or Horus – or forge your own path as mercenary Blackshields. Play out the story across six narrative missions, complete with new environment rules and stratagems – however you want to play, you'll find new rules for you.

—description from the publisher

CONTENTS
– An overview of the Defence of Ryza
– Background and Legion-specific rules for six Titan Legions: Honorum, Osedax, Crucius, Magna, Vulturum and Mortis
– Four new maniples to use in your games
– Background and rules for six Knight Houses: Sidus, Taranis, Zavora, Morbidia, Ioeden and Oroborn
– Full colour examples of paint schemes and heraldry for Titans and Knights
– Six narrative missions based on the dramatic events of the story
– Three different allegiances for your Titan Legions, and four for your Knight Houses
– Rules for creating your own Titan Legions, including 16 Traits, 15 Stratagems, and 21 pieces of Wargear
– Battle Standards, Lance Standards and High Kings to expand your Knight Households
– New environments: Manufactoria, Plasmatic Infrastructure and Ryza Secundus
– 11 new Stratagems to use in your games

A copy of the Adeptus Titanicus rules is required to use the contents of this book.
Families: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)

Name: Monopoly: Maastricht
Description:
An edition of the commercially successful board game, Monopoly. This edition takes in the Dutch city of Maastricht. 
Popular and well known areas are for sale including Koestraat, the Markt, the Kleine Staat and the Vrijthof.

Name: Máxima Definición
Description:
Máxima Definición is a free print and play board game, a simple game in which we will pretend to be playing a soccer game which has ended up tied, after extra time everything will be defined in the penalty shootout. Each player will intersperse roles as goalkeeper and as a player who kicks the penalty, they will have to choose carefully the different pieces to save and score ... who will win this match?

The game has a solitaire mode playing against an AI, the other mode is 2 players, but even more players can be played each pair with a copy of the game. Build your penalty tournaments and become the Maximum Definition champion.
The language independent game as the components only have icons.

—description from the designer

Name: Escape Mail
Description:
The Family Secrets Series is an escape room in an envelope. The series consists of 12 episodes which all follow the the story of your long lost cousin, JJ Fitzpatrick in your combined search for lost family treasure.

Episode 1 is an envelope addressed to you from your cousin JJ with some mysterious contents, and a letter stating that you and your family are entitled to a wealth of treasure, if you're smart enough to find it. What you don't know yet is just where this adventure will take you! Do you have what it takes to solve the mystery and claim your family's treasure?

The game can be completed in single standalone episodes or the entire 12 episode campaign arc can be purchased.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: A Crushing Terror
Description:
Solo game scenario for Warhammer Underworlds that allows a single player to pit their warband against a rampaging Fomoroid Crusher. The player wins the game by defeating the monster before it can escape off the board - or take all of their fighters out of action.

—description from the publisher

Name: Nusfjord: Salmon Deck
Description: Nusfjord: Salmon Deck contains 44 new building cards for players who have a good understanding of the base game, as well as 25 metal coins to replace the coins from the base game.

Name: Flames of War: Dietrich's Ghosts
Description:
The dust got into everything. 
Feldwebel Unger tied his handkerchief tighter across his nose and mouth, knowing it would make little difference, he could already feel the grit against his teeth. 
His platoon was sweeping across the steppes of the Eastern Ukraine, chasing the broken remnants of many Soviet armies. 
His Panzer IV had made it through a harsh winter and savage Red Army attacks around Kharkov, but now they were pushing back.

—description from the publisher

Name: Unlock!: Lastman
Description:
Lastman is a French series of graphic novels created by Bastien Vivès, Balak and Michaël Sanlaville.

"Unlock! Lastman" is a 24-card mini-adventure in the Unlock! series of card-driven escape room games. It is only for 1 to 2 players, ages 10 and over and plays in about 15 minutes.

Some bookstores in France gave this out to customers who bought two Lastman books.

It requires a free companion app to play.

Name: Fairy Tale Files: The Curious Case of the Poisoned Apples
Description:
An apple poisoning rocks Fairy Land! Then another! And another! Who is behind this evil spree? Unravel this strange affair and discover the antidote in time to save the fair maidens!

Collect the clues and solve the puzzles to find out!

The Fairy Tale Files are lighthearted murder mystery detective games inspired by iconic fairy tales. We bring  you the delight of your favorite childhood stories with an adult twist! Join the Magical Mishaps Agency to solve the clues and find the killer!

—description from the publisher

Name: Until the Bitter End:  Tanks
Description:
Until the Bitter End - Tanks is a World War 2 wargame.  This is the third game in the Until the Bitter End series and the first that focuses, solely, on tank (and other armoured fighting vehicles) battles. This is  a print and play game for solitaire and two-players. This is a standalone game in my series of WW2 print and play games. You don't need to have played or own the first games - all of the digital PDF files are included (you simply print it out, provide yourself with a regular six sided dice and a pencil).

—description from the designer

Name: Monopoly: Benevento Calcio
Description:
In the 90th year since its foundation, Benevento Calcio is the first Serie B team to join the large Monopoly family.

Play with the protagonists of the 2019/2020 season and relive the emotions related to the recent history of the Samnite Club. Challenge friends and relatives, manage your finances in the best possible way, show all your Giallorossi passion and become the champion of Benevento Calcio Monopoly.


Nel 90esimo anno dalla sua fondazione, il Benevento Calcio é la prima squadra della Lega Serie B ad entrare nella grande famiglia del Monopoly.

Gioca con i protagonisti della stagione 2019/2020 e rivivi le emozioni legate alla storia recente del Club sannita. Sfida amici e parenti, amministra al meglio le tue finanze, mostra tutta la tua passione giallorossa e diventa il campione di Benevento Calcio Monopoly.

Name: Monopoly: SSC Napoli
Description:
With the Monopoly SSC Napoli, fans and supporters will be able to challenge each other, between probabilities and unexpected events, retracing the most exciting moments in the recent history of SSC Napoli.


Monopoly SSC Napoli Calcio, appassionati e tifosi potranno sfidarsi, tra probabilità ed imprevisti, ripercorrendo i momenti più emozionanti della recente storia del SSC Napoli.

Name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Justice League International
Description: 6 detailed resin figures and character cards for the DC Universe game.  Includes Blue Beetle, Booster Gold, Doctor Fate, Martian Manhunter, Mr. Miracle, and Shazam.

Name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Lexcorp Army
Description: 6 detailed resin figures and character cards for the DC Universe Miniature game.  Includes Lex Luthor Warsuit, Metallo, Lexcorp Heavy Trooper, and 3 Lexcorp Troopers.

Name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Suicide Squad
Description: Contains 6 detailed resin figures and character cards for the DC Universe Miniature Game.  Includes Bronze Tiger, Deadshot, Deathstroke, Katana, Killer Croc, and Killer Frost.

Name: Monopoly: Airborne Museum
Description:
The Airborne Museum of Sainte-Mère-Eglise presents its own edition of the game Monopoly. In this version, the Rue de la Paix gives way to the Waco glider, the Place du Paradis has become an M2 helmet and instead of becoming the owner of the Boulevard des Capucines, players will be able to acquire a Sherman tank. The players are thus in the shoes of a museum curator and will compete to acquire the most beautiful collector's items from the Airborne Museum!


L'Airborne Museum de Sainte-Mère-Eglise présente sa propre édition du jeu Monopoly. Dans cette version, la rue de la paix laisse place au planeur Waco, la place du Paradis est devenue un casque M2 et à la place de devenir propriétaire du boulevard des Capucines, les joueurs pourront acquérir un char Sherman. Les joueurs sont ainsi dans la peau d'un conservateur de musée et s'affronteront pour acquérir les plus belles pièces de collection du Airborne Museum !

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – War of the Outer Gods: Scenario Pack
Description:
Our world may seem significant—the center of our personal universes. But amidst the unknowable eldritch Mythos, Earth is a tiny microcosm of primitive life, a laughable mote of dirt and water floating among the stars. We are merely dust on the scales, and any larger ambition only demonstrates an unfortunate surplus of damning hubris.

In the face of this crushing insignificance, the investigators of the Arkham Horror Files are those who push back against the abyss, who refuse to give in to nihilism and despair. But with the latest adventure, those investigators face a challenge unlike any they’ve tackled before.

In War of the Outer Gods, a new scenario pack for Arkham Horror: The Card Game, Arkham is caught in the midst of a world-shattering conflict between three rival cults, raging across all of North America. Each of these cults seeks to summon its own Ancient One—and as they battle each other across the continent, every enemy slain brings one of these dark gods closer to awakening. Can you and your fellow investigators survive being caught in the middle of this war, or will our world be torn asunder?

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Monopoly: Edizione Napoli
Description:
Monopoly: Edizione Napoli this edition takes in the Italian city of Naples.

The board shows the Neapolitan toponymy: places such as la pizzeria di quartiere, la gelateria del cuore, il parco giochi.

Name: 矩陣謎語 (Lost in the Grids)
Description:
çŸ©é™£è¬Žèªž (Lost in the Grids) was released as part of the 2020 Taiwanese convention "150 Boardgame Con" where games sell for 150 TWD, roughly $5 USD.

The game consists of a limited deck of cards, with suits visible on the back; some player tokens; and some magnifying glass tokens.

The players' goal is to arrange the cards into a grid such that no suit or rank is duplicated in a row or column.  On a turn, a player may choose to use the magnifying glass tokens to peak at a card in the grid or a players hand; then, they must play two cards, one face up and one face down, and can play them into the grid or aside.

At the end of the game, all cards are flipped face up and any cards in a row or column which share a suit or rank are removed.  Players earn positive points for cards remaining in the grid and unused tokens, and lose points for cards removed from the grid.  The players can then compare their score to a rubric to see how well they did, from "No comment." to "Psychic!"

Name: S'Crew UP: Bots & Nuts
Description:
S’Crew Up: Bots & Nuts is a strategic two-player worker placement and a take-that game where it is all about mechanical efficiency and smashed robots.

After an update in the factory’s systems, robots teamed up others from the same manufacturer to improve productivity and get everything fixed. But a bug in the patch caused a frantic side effect: in the pursuit of being harder, better, faster, and stronger, robots are now smashing smaller ones and even creating new problems.

With a length of approximately 30 minutes, the game is played in alternate turns. Players control 4 different robots to execute actions and collect resources, fixing problems, or robots that were smashed by the opponent. The first crew to clear their workshop, fixing all problems, and lining up all its robots in the Production Line of the factory wins the game.

Turns are simple and divided into three phases: In the first, robots in the workshop charge up; in the second, a single robot is called up to activate its quadrant in the Production Line, generating resources to fix problems and other robots. In the last phase, the available robots can be lined up in quadrants of the Production Line for later activation.

Although robots can block quadrants from the Production Line by their presence there, bigger robots can smash them out, sending their pieces to their workshops to be fixed.

As problems are fixed and players get closer to winning, combos are forged, and in a blink of an eye, your opponent can take you from certain victory to an “hasta la vista” defeat.

How to end the game? The first player to finish his turn with his office empty, solving all problems and allocating all robots on the production line, wins the game.

-description from designer
Families: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

Name: Dinosaur World: Hybrid Pack
Description:
The scientists in Dinosaur World never thought to ask if they should. They have decided to tinker with nature itself by combining the DNA of different dinosaurs to create brand new species never seen before.

Guests are always looking for something new and more exciting, and it's not like nature was gonna make new Dinosaur types.

This expansion comes with 3 new dinosaurs that are a hybrid of different types: Galliraptor (herbivore Gallimimus & small carnivore Raptor), Tyrannaceratops (herbivore Triceratops & large carnivore T-Rex), and Velocidon (small carnivore Velociraptor & large canivore Pteranodon).

It also includes the dino enclosure tile for each new hybrid dino and a special new black die. When visiting a hybrid dino enclosure tile, you will roll both dice of that dino's types (example: roll both herbivore and small carnivore dice for Galliraptor) AND the new black die, which offers excitement or security.
 These new dinos grant higher victory point levels, but it comes with increased threat as well. However, their dual types are quite versatile, as they can satisfy the various objectives and tiles seen in the game!

Contents: 6 Dinosaurs (18 color meeples), 6 park tiles, 1 die.

Name: Rugby Sevens: the Game
Description:
A two-player tabletop game, based on Rugby Sevens. The game is primarily card-based, with dice used for kicking options. 
Gameplay involved players taking turns to use an action, which can be to bring a player into the area of play, pass, run, tackle, etc. They players have individual ability values that affect their performance.
There are General Play cards that are collected and used through the game to enhance gameplay.
The game includes set play options for Rucks, Scrums, and Lineouts.

—description from the publisher

Name: Instacrime: Casino
Description:
Granada is a beautiful city in the South of Spain where you can find all kinds of people. Like any other night, after a fancy dinner at the casino, four players meet around a poker table. They are Vladimir Lavrov “The Russian”, escorted by his bodyguard Sasha, Brad Clayton, Claudine, and her friend Sophie. One of the players will never see a new day.

Instacrime is a cooperative game system which introduces you to a mystery that needs to be solved by a group of detectives. Each player must describe the contents of their photographs in order to share the information at their disposal with the objective of setting out a joint theory that explains the case.

Each case is unique and unrepeatable, and therefore, it can only be played once.

But don’t worry! If you want to make the most of it, let a group of friends play it and have fun listening to their theories.

-description from the publisher

Name: On to Baghdad
Description:
On to Baghdad: The Campaign in Mesopotamia and Persia in World War I - is an operational-strategic level, two-player wargame covering the campaign in Mesopotamia and Persia in World War I. Players control either the Allies representing the British-Indian, Russians pro-Allied Persians, Kuwaitis, and pro-Allied Partisans or the Central Powers representing the Ottoman Turks (or Turks), Germans, Austro-Hungarian, pro-CP Persians, and pro-CP Partisans. The Allied objective is to gain strategic control of Mesopotamia and Persia, including oil resources and critical cities. The Central Powers objective is to retain control and threaten British interests in the Persian Gulf and India Each hex on the map represents 35 kilometers. Each turn represents six months. Ground units are mostly divisions, with breakdowns. Air units are mainly squadrons. Partisans represent groups of guerrillas.

Originally published in S&T #331 Nov-Dec 2021

Game Scale:
Game Turn: Six months
Hex: 22 miles / 35 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Division

Players will need to provide one six-sided die

Name: Thirty Years War Battles: Lutter & Wittstock
Description:
Thirty Years War Battles is a grand tactical two player system for simulating battles in Europe during the first half of the 17th century. Each game in the system is based on one of the major battles of the 30 Years War. Each battle has its own map, special rules and counters representing the military formations which participated in the original action. The rules model the overall effects of the weapons and tactics of the great era of pike and shot, and include combat, leadership and morale. Players command armies of infantry, cavalry and artillery, each with their own special capabilities, as well as the great leaders who took the field in this era. Each hex on the map represents 150-200 meters. Each game turn (GT) represents 45 minutes to one hour. Most cavalry and infantry units represent one or two regiments or battalions. Each combat strength point represents 75 to 150 men, depending on the quality of the army and assignment of light guns to the unit. Each artillery unit represents four to six heavy or medium guns.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters.

S&T #332 Nov-Dec 2021

Name: Operation Unthinkable
Description:
Operation Unthinkable is a two player alternative history wargame intended to investigate the strategic parameters that would have been in place during the first month of operations had the Anglo-Allies and Soviets gone to war against each other starting on or about July 1945. The map illustrates the militarily significant terrain found in and around this portion of Germany in 1945 when portrayed at this scale. Each hex on the map represents five miles (8 km) from side to opposite side. The Soviet units of maneuver are corps or corps equivalents (western division equivalents). Those on the Allied side are mostly divisions, along with a separate brigades and regiments. The rules abstractly represent air power with the presumption that the Allies would have unchallengeable air supremacy. Each full game turn represents half a week of real time.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 228 counters.

S&T #333 Jan-Feb 2022

Name: Rio Grande War
Description:
"Rio Grande War" is a two-player wargame on a hypothetical war between the United States and the Empire of Mexico following the American Civil War. The assumption is that France's Napoleon III decided to back up Maximilian with the French army to maintain his power in Mexico, and the US responded with an invasion. At stake: the fate of North America!

One side commands the Imperial forces (Maximilian and his French allies), and the other the Allies (US and Mexican Republic). The central game mechanism is Action Points (AP). AP are a quantification of each sides command and logistical capabilities. Players expend AP to recruit units and conduct various military operations. Each hex on the map represents 45 miles. Each game turn (GT) represents one to two months. Combat units represent divisions, brigades, regiments, and groups of partisans/bandits. Infantry and cavalry units include attached artillery, pioneer and logistic support. Leaders represent an inspirational to competent commander plus whatever troops they bring to the field.
Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters.

S&T #334 Mar-Apr 2022
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Descent on Malta
Description:
Descent on Malta is a solitaire operational level simulation of the planned but never executed Axis airborne assault on the British island fortress of Malta. The player controls Axis forces (Germans and Italians). The game system controls the opposing Allied forces and reaction. The objective of the game is for the Axis to capture Malta at the lowest possible cost in casualties. The design is based on the Crete '41 game (World at War #47). The game includes optional rules that allow for two or more players to control different parts of the Axis invasion.
